meanings.definition: A group of organisms belonging to the same taxonomic category.
meanings.sent1: The phylon of birds includes various species like eagles and sparrows.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the phylon of insects to understand their evolutionary history.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the phylon of monkeys decided to have a banana-eating contest.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the phylon of trees stood tall like guardians of nature.
meanings.sent5: The phylon of fish in the ocean moved together like a shimmering rainbow.

meanings.definition: A group of people united by common interests or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The phylon of book lovers gathered at the library for a reading session.
meanings.sent2: In the community center, the phylon of artists shared their latest creations.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, the phylon of dancers performed a spontaneous flash mob.
meanings.sent4: The phylon of students in the chess club strategized together to win the tournament.
meanings.sent5: In the park, the phylon of dog owners chatted while their pets played joyfully.
